summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message from Pastor Travis Hearn about feeling overlooked! Sometimes in life, we feel invisible, like God doesn't see us or our struggles. PT brilliantly breaks down what to do when you feel hidden or forgotten. He shares a powerful personal story about being the last picked at 'Chicken Park' and transforms that painful memory into a profound spiritual lesson. The sermon's core message? God isn't ignoring you - He's PREPARING you! Just like David was overlooked by his own family but hand-picked by God, you might be in a season of preparation, not punishment. Pastor Travis provides four incredible strategies for those feeling unseen: grow your character, sharpen your skills, develop a fruitful network, and most importantly, continue growing your relationship with God. The most transformative moment? When he reminds us that true living comes from GIVING, not getting. Whether you're feeling overlooked in your career, relationships, or spiritual journey, this sermon is a lifeline of hope and divine strategy!
mainPoints: God sees you even when others overlook you
Use seasons of hiddenness to develop character and skills
Pursue a relationship with God, not just what He can do for you

versesMentioned.text: But the Lord said to Samuel, 'Do not consider his appearance or his height, for I have rejected him. The Lord does not look at the things people look at. People look at the outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the heart.'
This is to my Father's glory, that you bear much fruit, showing yourselves to be my disciples.
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control. Against such things there is no law.

Blessed is the one who trusts in the Lord, whose confidence is in him. They will be like a tree planted by the water that sends out its roots by the stream. It does not fear when heat comes; its leaves are always green. It has no worries in a year of drought and never fails to bear fruit.
He cuts off every branch in me that bears no fruit, while every branch that does bear fruit he prunes so that it will be even more fruitful.
Be on your guard; stand firm in the faith; be courageous; be strong.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 139:16: 'Your eyes saw my unformed body; all the days ordained for me were written in your book before one of them came to be.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing God's intentional plan for your life
Monday.action: Write down three areas where you currently feel overlooked. Pray and ask God to reveal His purpose in these seasons.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me trust Your timing and Your process. Reveal to me the areas where You are developing my character and preparing me for Your purpose. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Tuesday.focus: Developing trust during seasons of waiting
Tuesday.action: Identify one skill you can deliberately improve this week. Commit to practicing it daily.
Tuesday.prayer: God, show me the skills You want me to develop. Give me patience and persistence to grow, even when no one is watching. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 1:6: 'Being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.'
Wednesday.focus: Understanding spiritual growth is a process
Wednesday.action: Review your current relationships. Identify connections that are life-giving and those that might be draining your spiritual energy.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, give me wisdom to nurture relationships that draw me closer to You and to prune those that hinder my spiritual growth. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Ephesians 2:10: 'For we are God's handiwork, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.'
Thursday.focus: Recognizing your unique value in God's plan
Thursday.action: Spend time journaling about your unique gifts. How can you use them to serve others this week?
Thursday.prayer: Lord, reveal my spiritual gifts and show me how to use them to glorify You and serve others. Help me see my worth through Your eyes. Amen.

Friday.scripture: James 1:4: 'Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.'
Friday.action: Choose one area of your character you want to improve. Create a specific, measurable goal for growth.
Friday.prayer: God, refine my character. Help me see challenges as opportunities for spiritual development. Give me strength to persevere. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Matthew 6:33: 'But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.'
Saturday.action: Spend extended time in prayer and worship. Ask God to reveal His specific vision for your life.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my plans and desires to You. Align my heart with Your purpose. Show me how to seek You first in every area of my life. Amen.
